subject: Management
title: The Time Audit
description: A quick, practical guide to The Time Audit.

hook.text: A manager tracked her time for one week. She spent 23 hours in meetings she didn't need to attend.

buildup.text: Most people have no idea where their time actually goes. They guess, and they guess wrong.

discovery.text: Peter Drucker: you can't manage what you don't measure. Track your time before changing it.

twist.text: The audit always surprises. The gap between felt time and real time is enormous.

climax.text: Track every 30-minute block for one week. No judgment. Just data. Then decide what to change.

punchline.text: You can't fix your schedule until you see it clearly.

quiz.question: What is the first step in time management?
options: Tracking where your time actually goes for a full week
Immediately cutting all meetings from your calendar
Reading a book about productivity techniques
